reviewText: I've been trying to find "Beethoven" (the first) in widescreen format for a long time and for some idiotic reason Universal Studios won't release it in WS. I bought the VHS long time ago and I was hoping this dvd would bring this good movie in the original WS format for a better experience in the newer flat screen tv sets but no, it comes in full screen format. Who cares for full screen nowadays? Thumbs down to Universal.

reviewText: Beethoven- Today is my 19th Birthday, and this movie is a childhood favorite that I received as a Christmas present back in 1992. This movie is very funny if you are a dog-lover. Little Beethoven escapes from some bad guys and wonders into the Newton house. The children and mom thinks that George Newton got him, but he hates the idea of keeping him. He slowly starts to like Beethoven, until he thinks that Beethoven bites a doctor who wants to run tests on him. Later, the Newton family hurry to save their beloved dog. I highly recommend BEETHOVEN!!!Beethoven's 2nd- Today is my 19th Birthday and this movie is a childhood favorite. In my opinion, the first two Beethoven movies are the only worthwhile chapters in the 'series' Beethoven is discovering love and finds a female St. Bernard named Missy. Brillo and Regina are going through a divorce and evil Regina wants to keep Missy to make Brillo's life miserable without her. Beethoven and Missy make sweet passionate love and Missy gives birth to 4 baby puppies. The Newton kids try to hide them from their parents. Later, after the parents find out, they spend vacation at a cottage and Ryce goes to a party where all the guys are getting drunk. Regina loses Missy again and makes her puppies find her, so the Newton family has to come to the rescue. I highly recommend BEETHOVEN'S 2ND!!!
